job_description: Senior Lead Software Engineer, Full Stack (Remote-Eligible) - job post Capital One 10,038 reviews San Francisco, CA 94102 • Remote Full-time, Part-time Capital One 10,038 reviews Read what people are saying about working here. You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Encouraged to Apply Fair chance Job Type Full-time Part-time West Creek 2 (12072), United States of America, Richmond, Virginia Senior Lead Software Engineer, Full Stack (Remote-Eligible) Do you love building and pioneering in the technology space? Do you enjoy solving complex business problems in a fast-paced, collaborative, inclusive, and iterative delivery environment? At Capital One, you'll be part of a big group of makers, breakers, doers and disruptors, who solve real problems and meet real customer needs. We are seeking Full Stack Software Engineers who are passionate about marrying data with emerging technologies. As a Capital One Senior Lead Software Engineer, you’ll have the opportunity to be on the forefront of driving a major transformation within Capital One. Team Info: Premium Products & Experiences Technology team is on a journey to expand and enhance our credit card benefits. The team is delivering tech solutions that provide customers personalized, compelling and the best-in-class experiences that motivate them to have Capital One be first in wallet. We are looking for an individual contributor with a strong technology background to lead the team through consolidating a multi-cloud infrastructure while delivering the right solution to the right customer with a customer centric experience. What You’ll Do: Lead a portfolio of diverse technology projects and a team of developers with deep experience in distributed microservices, and full stack systems to create solutions that help meet regulatory needs for the company Share your passion for staying on top of tech trends, experimenting with and learning new technologies, participating in internal & external technology communities, mentoring other members of the engineering community, and from time to time, be asked to code or evaluate code Collaborate with digital product managers, and deliver robust cloud-based solutions that drive powerful experiences to help millions of Americans achieve financial empowerment Utilize programming languages like JavaScript, Java, Node, HTML/CSS, TypeScript, React, React Native, Open Source RDBMS and NoSQL databases, Container Orchestration services including Docker and Kubernetes, and a variety of GCP and AWS tools and services Capital One is open to hiring a Remote Employee for this opportunity. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree At least 8 years of experience in software engineering (Internship experience does not apply) At least 1 year experience with cloud computing (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud) Preferred Qualifications: Master’s Degree 9+ years of experience in at least one of the following: JavaScript, Java, Node, TypeScript, React, or React Native 4+ years of experience with AWS and GCP 4+ years of experience in open source frameworks 1+ years of people management experience 2+ years of experience in Agile practices Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position. The minimum and maximum full-time annual salaries for this role are listed below, by location. Please note that this salary information is solely for candidates hired to perform work within one of these locations, and refers to the amount Capital One is willing to pay at the time of this posting. Salaries for part-time roles will be prorated based upon the agreed upon number of hours to be regularly worked. Location is New York City: $230,100 - $262,700 for Sr. Lead Software Engineer Location is San Francisco, California: $243,800 - $278,200 for Sr. Lead Software Engineer Remote roles in other areas of New York & California, and across Colorado & Washington: $195,000 - $222,600 for Sr. Lead Software Engineer Candidates hired to work in other locations will be subject to the pay range associated with that location, and the actual annualized salary amount offered to any candidate at the time of hire will be reflected solely in the candidate’s offer letter. This role is also eligible to earn performance based incentive compensation, which may include cash bonus(es) and/or long term incentives (LTI). Incentives could be discretionary or non discretionary depending on the plan. Capital One offers a comprehensive, competitive, and inclusive set of health, financial and other benefits that support your total well-being. Learn more at the Capital One Careers website. Eligibility varies based on full or part-time status, exempt or non-exempt status, and management level. No agencies please. Capital One is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, age, national origin, religion, physical and mental disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/assignment, citizenship, pregnancy or maternity, protected veteran status, or any other status prohibited by applicable national, federal, state or local law. Capital One promotes a drug-free workplace. Capital One will consider for employment qualified applicants with a criminal history in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable laws regarding criminal background inquiries, including, to the extent applicable, Article 23-A of the New York Correction Law; San Francisco, California Police Code Article 49, Sections 4901-4920; New York City’s Fair Chance Act; Philadelphia’s Fair Criminal Records Screening Act; and other applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations regarding criminal background inquiries. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation, please contact Capital One Recruiting at 1-800-304-9102 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations. Senior Manager, Technical Account Manager, Solutions Architect (Remote Eligible) - job post Capital One 10,038 reviews San Francisco, CA 94102 • Remote Full-time, Part-time Capital One 10,038 reviews Read what people are saying about working here. You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Encouraged to Apply Fair chance Job Type Full-time Part-time Center 1 (19052), United States of America, McLean, Virginia Senior Manager, Technical Account Manager, Solutions Architect (Remote Eligible) Capital One is seeking a Solutions Architect to work in our Enterprise Data Tech organization as a Technical Account Manager. This individual will be accountable to drive a cohesive data strategy across the enterprise data platforms for our internal customers. This role will lead horizontally and collaborate across teams to deliver scalable data solutions to our customers. This leader must have the technical skills to ensure that we build compelling, customer-oriented solutions. Success in the role requires an innovative mind, a proven track record of delivering highly complex solutions end to end, rigorous organization skills, and a passion for delivering customer value. We are looking for technologists who love learning and introducing new technology in order to help customers achieve their objectives. Our Technical Account Managers are: Technologists: Strong technology background with the ability to learn quickly and go deep into our product and engineering solutions Effective Communicators: An exceptional writer with strong written, oral, and verbal communications skills who can present complex subject matter in a clear, concise, and compelling manner to stakeholders across all levels Partnership Attitude: Have the competencies to build strong partnerships with other leaders across product and technology Curious: Hands-on, "roll up your sleeves" collaborative style of working to provide end to end resolution to the customer Accountable: Ability to build trusting relationships by ensuring we provide detailed follow ups and drive end to end resolution across multiple initiatives at once Passionate: Bring energy and enthusiasm to the job and organization Bold: History of taking smart, calculated risks and aggressively leading through change Achievers: Consistently attain/exceed individual and team goals What you’ll do in the role: Craft and execute strategies to drive our customers’ adoption and use of Enterprise Data platforms Represent Enterprise Data within a customer’s organization, and drive discussions with senior leadership regarding new capabilities, incidents, trade-offs and risks Drive effective end to end solutions to meet the needs of our internal customers Develop trusting relationships with customers, to understand their needs and technical challenges, and help them achieve the greatest value from Enterprise Data Guide customers on how to properly use Enterprise Data Platforms, educating them on best practices Engage partner and customers teams to define technical requirements for Enterprise Data platforms Proactively find opportunities for customers to gain additional value out of target state tools & platforms Partner with technical and product stakeholders to build & define intent for enterprise efforts crossing all types of technologies Capital One is open to hiring a Remote Employee for this opportunity. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree At least 6 years of experience with design or implementation of distributed applications At least 3 years of experience managing technical, customer facing solution architects At least 2 years of experience creating solutions architectures in a public cloud (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud) Preferred Qualifications: Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering Information Technology 7+ years of technical solutioning, client engagement or software engineering experience Ability to communicate complex technical concepts clearly to a variety of audiences. Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position. Senior Distinguished Engineer, Innovation Lab (Remote Eligible) - job post Capital One 10,038 reviews San Francisco, CA 94102 • Remote Full-time, Part-time Capital One 10,038 reviews Read what people are saying about working here. You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Encouraged to Apply Fair chance Job Type Full-time Part-time Center 1 (19052), United States of America, McLean, Virginia Senior Distinguished Engineer, Innovation Lab (Remote Eligible) Distinguished Engineers are individual contributors who strive to be diverse in thought so we visualize the problem space. At Capital One, we believe diversity of thought strengthens our ability to influence, collaborate and provide the most innovative solutions across organizational boundaries. Distinguished Engineers will significantly impact our trajectory and devise clear roadmaps to deliver next generation technology solutions. Capital One is looking for an experienced senior technologist to join the Lab to solve complex and mind-bending problems and to help us reimagine banking. You will join a fast paced team that iterates daily, questions the status quo, and takes on dozens of new projects every year. Solutions generated by those inside the Lab improve fraud detection, enhance online shopping, and help bank employees do their jobs better. Deep technical experts and thought leaders that help accelerate adoption of the very best engineering practices, while maintaining knowledge on industry innovations, trends and practices Visionaries, collaborating on Capital One’s toughest issues, to deliver on business needs that directly impact the lives of our customers and associates Role models and mentors, helping to coach and strengthen the technical expertise and know-how of our engineering and product community Evangelists, both internally and externally, helping to elevate the Distinguished Engineering community and establish themselves as a go-to resource on given technologies and technology-enabled capabilities Responsibilities: Build awareness, increase knowledge and drive adoption of modern technologies, sharing consumer and engineering benefits to gain buy-in Strike the right balance between lending expertise and providing an inclusive environment where others’ ideas can be heard and championed; leverage expertise to grow skills in the broader Capital One team Promote a culture of engineering excellence, using opportunities to reuse and innersource solutions where possible Effectively communicate with and influence key stakeholders across the enterprise, at all levels of the organization Operate as a trusted advisor for a specific technology, platform or capability domain, helping to shape use cases and implementation in an unified manner Lead the way in creating next-generation talent for Tech, mentoring internal talent and actively recruiting external talent to bolster Capital One’s Tech talent Capital One is open to hiring a Remote Employee for this opportunity. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree At least 9 years of experience in software development At least 5 years of experience with cloud native technologies At least 3 years of experience with front-end engineering, including web technologies or mobile frameworks (iOS, Android) Preferred Qualifications: 10+ years of software development experience 7+ years of experience designing and building enterprise platform solutions 5+ years of experience with Amazon Web Services 5+ years of experience in start-up environment Experience working in or leading a Lab Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position. Sr. Java Developer/Lead - job post Mind Solutions LLC San Francisco, CA $45 - $55 an hour -  Full-time, Part-time, Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $45 - $55 an hour Job Type Full-time Part-time Contract Sr. Java Developer) Location: (On-Site) Experience: 8-10 Years Contract: H4EAD/GC/USC/L2EAD/TNVISA/E3 (No H1b & OPTs) - W2 ONLY Requirements Your future duties and responsibilities: Advanced proficiency in coding in Java 8, Spring Boot technologies as well as Junit testing experience and Cucumber Automation Testing. Work on cloud transformation effort, move application components to AWS, update code, create/run CICD pipeline. Work with product owners and other development team members to determine new features and user stories needed in new/revised applications or large/complex development projects. Create or Update documentation in support of development efforts. Documents may include detailed specifications, implementation guides, architecture diagrams or design documents. Participate in code reviews with peers and managers to ensure that each increment adheres to original vision as described in the user story and all standard resource libraries and architecture patterns as appropriate. Participate in all agile ceremonies including planning, grooming, product demonstration and team retrospectives. Leverage client DevOps tool stack to build, inspect, deploy in cloud platform, test and promote new or updated features. Understand the application code with minimal assistance and resolve bugs/defects/performance issues identified. Required qualifications to be successful in this role: 8+ years of development experience in Java/J2EE technologies ​ 3+ years of development experience with Java 8, S​pring boot, Spring Core, Spring MVC, Spring Security and REST Web Services is a must. ​ Angular 8+ experience required Hands-on AWS Cloud Implementation experience​​ is a MUST Competent in distributed systems design and implementation. Experience with Object-Oriented Design and test-driven development. Advanced proficiency in unit testing as well as coding in Java 8 and Spring Boot technologies Strong experience in testing automation using Junit ​​Strong experience with Microservices Strong hands-on experience in Oracle and Aurora postgreSQL RDS Knowledge of ECS and Dockers Experience with debugging and troubleshooting App performance issues & JVM memory optimization. Experience with working on SOAP webservices, XML, JAXB Experience with build tools like Maven/Gradle & Jenkins Experience working in Agile environment, preferably SAFe ​ Superior time management and work organization Strong verbal and oral communication​​​​ Work as a team and lead others in a fast paced agile environment Passion for continuous improvement ​​and learning​​ Desired Skillset ​Selenium/Cucumber for testing is a PLUS EDUCATION REQUIREMENT ​Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field​​​​​​​ AWS Associate level certification desired, Oracle certification desired Skills: J2EE Java Jenkins Spring Boot Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract Pay: $45.00 - $55.00 per hour Schedule: 8 hour shift Education: Bachelor's (Required) Experience: Spring MVC: 10 years (Required) Spring Boot: 8 years (Required) Git: 8 years (Required) Maven build: 8 years (Required) Agile: 8 years (Required) Jenkins: 8 years (Required) J2EE: 8 years (Required) Java: 8 years (Required) AWS: 8 years (Required) Work Location: In person If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.
